column4: I've installed 10.04 UNR, which doesn't have gcc installed by default and it doesn't support any network cards in my netbook (AR8132 and broadcom wifi) without compiling a driver which needs gcc, and I can't download gcc without the network. Is there any way to install gcc when doing a fresh install from the netbook 10.04 image? aside from mounting the usb disk and using it as an apt source -
which didn't work. Or is there a UNR which includes gcc by default?
ive seen none that include it by default.
yeah it's a crappy NIC in there which is supported but the included drivers in ubuntu are buggy and don't work
